intro: Flickingeria calocephala, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or swampy areas. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with prominent white veins, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Flickingeria calocephala is often found in wetlands and is adapted to thrive in humid, tropical climates.
